title: looking for decorative initials and ornaments
content:
I would like to buy a few collections of decorative initials and ornaments in vector format. Any suggestions or sources?

 [‹ Single white female seeking: Big black squarish italic fellow...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32536 "Go to previous forum topic") [Magazine Grid ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32630 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Beta

comments.content:
Briarpress has a growing library of digitized versions of [old letterpress cuts for free](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180927/http:/www.briarpress.org/cuts).

Of course, if you plan on using a bunch of them you probably want to [consider making a donation](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180927/http:/www.briarpress.org/donate).

Oh, anything Renaissance or historic—or just interesting.  
I just got a fun DVD of wood type impression scans that my students are having a good time with. Whenever I have a few dollars left at year’s end, I like to get something new for them to play with.

I stumbled across this site awhile back - [http://moorstation.org/typoasis/typeart.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180927/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/typeart.htm "http://moorstation.org/typoasis/typeart.htm") .

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Hiro
